Definition: In this task, you are given a review from Amazon and a category for the product. Your task is to determine whether the given category matches the review. Generate "True" if the review and its category match, otherwise generate "False".

Positive Examples.input:
Review: Arrived broken. Manufacturer defect. Two of the legs of the base were not completely formed, so there was no way to insert the casters. I unpackaged the entire chair and hardware before noticing this. So, I'll spend twice the amount of time boxing up the whole useless thing and send it back with a 1-star review of part of a chair I never got to sit in. I will go so far as to include a picture of what their injection molding and quality assurance process missed though. I will be hesitant to buy again. It makes me wonder if there aren't missing structures and supports that don't impede the assembly process. 
 Category: furniture
Positive Examples.explanation: It's the correct category. Because the customer gives a review of the product which belongs to the furniture category, which we can see it from the way the customer describes his experience sharing how he unpackaged his chair.

Fortunately, not sharp shards, just rounded edges, but some of the pieces landed almost six feet away from the shelf where the measuring cup was sitting. Scary.

Reviews: I bought 2 of these for my hummingbirds and after one week I had to take them down. Their design allows for bees to get to the sugar solution, and they almost drove the hummingbirds away. I changed the sugar solution ratio and moved the hangers to a shaded area to try to discourage the bees but nothing worked. If this sounds familiar, don't lose hope. Just purchase a feeder where the openings are facing upward so no sugar solution can drip out, and the bees will get discouraged and leave. With my new feeder, I can watch the hummingbirds feeding without the bees to harass them. 
 Category: pc
